alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for office and workshop equipment and supplies
body:
$!As an employer, you don’t have to report or pay tax and National Insurance on equipment, supplies or services you provide on your premises - as long as your employee needs it to do their job.$!

Examples include:

- office or workshop accommodation (not living accommodation)
- office or workshop furniture and equipment, eg desks, computers, work benches and tools
- stationery
- telephone and internet connections

^ Different rules apply if your employee works from home. See the [homeworking](/expenses-and-benefits-homeworking "homeworking") guide for more information. ^
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers providing office and workshop equipment and supplies
title: Expenses and benefits: office and workshop equipment and supplies
